intro: Critesion mustersii, commonly known as the St. John's Wort of the highlands, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central America. It belongs to the family Lythraceae and is characterized by its vibrant orange-red flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows in rocky or disturbed soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, with a slightly hairy texture. It is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and forest edges.
